text:
Eight months of music at Bologna Festival 2015 to end on Nov 5 Published on : Wednesday, September 23, 2015
Music, great orchestra conductors and a full season of concerts for the 34th edition of the “Bologna Festival” which brought names like Riccardo Muti, Daniel Harding, Philip Pickett to the capital of Emilia-Romagna from March 18th to November 5th.
Eight months of exclusive events and concert productions for the Italian territory characterized the well-known spring festival, which is divided into three sections: Great Performers (March 18th to October 7th), Talents (April 7th to June 6th), the Old and the New (from September 14th to November 5th).
Symphonic concerts alternate with solo recitals, chamber music cycles with more contemporary projects: the new 2015 trends in the field of classical music all pass through the Bologna Festival. To give a new twist to the event, however, on June 16th the exhibition exceptionally moved to the Florence Opera, for the new production of Pelléas et Mélisande by Debussy within the Maggio Musicale Fiorentino schedule.
The event therefore falls within the large and well-known Italian musical tradition, known throughout the world, which offers a wide range of musical events for lovers of opera, classical and contemporary music throughout the year. Bologna la Dotta (“Bologna the erudite” as it is often named), the city of art and culture and home of the first Italian university, is one of its ideal locations.
